column4: hello, Whats the correct syntax for adding a resolution to xorg.conf? All Display subsections only have 1440x900, but I need to add 1280x1024 for external monitor?
just add it the way the others are in there
beside the other ones
so do I add another subsection? or should it be Modes "1440x900" "1280x1024"
i believe you have to put it near the other ones yes, not another subsection
ok, I'll back it up first and try it. Thanks.
just add "1280x1024" next to the other resolutions you have there
yes of course, sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf  /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak
no luck. I'm trying to get my dell laptop to boot up on a docking station, which has a 1280x1024 LCD attached to it. It working on Dapper, but not edgy. any ideas?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg   could do the trick
ok, I'll try it, brb
that didn't work. xServer crashed, and I had to restore the old .conf file. Could it be b/c I have the binary installed, and not nvidia-glx?
mm, are you sure the syntax is right ?
pastebin your xorg.conf contents please
ok gotta get that computer on the network
maybe easier if you got a USB stick
did you see the link to my pastebin of my xorg.conf file?
yes
ook, sorry...
is this your working one or your not working one ?
the working one
i also noticed that 3d screensavers are extremely slow
try changing "nv" to "nvidia" in the Driver section
any ideas?
